revised_title: Exploration and Analysis of Brixham Cave: A Report on the Geological Findings and Organic Remains
tldr: The Royal Society-funded exploration of Brixham Cave uncovered a wealth of organic remains and evidence of prehistoric human habitation. The cave's stratified layers provided valuable insights into the superposition of undoubted remains of the Reindeer above the so-called 'Flint Knives,' suggesting that the Reindeer continued to be an inhabitant of Britain after the appearance of humans in the region.
